intro: Adnaria reticulata, commonly known as the nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Adnaria reticulata is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy species in various environments.
